title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 October 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:43 <polx> has quit  
00:44 <vmassol> has quit  
01:11 <jvelo> has quit  
03:45 <jstoldt|Notebook> has joined #xwiki  
03:46 <jstoldt|Notebook> seriously guys and gals; regarding XAADMINISTRATION-215  
03:48 <jstoldt|Notebook> i don't mind you making up your mind but pushing the issue back and forth almost two years later. however, assigning it to a number of people on fix/patch day and coming up with the solution to delete issue because it is no longer an issue... well, that just seems absurd  
03:53 <jstoldt|Notebook> regarding XWIKI-6382: please don't mind me not commenting on topic but i figure that i expected to the first slide to set or the name of the imported file or something to set the pages name. for all i can recall (from that bug report) the observed issue included no title to be set when otherwise it was set.  
03:54 <jstoldt|Notebook> otherwise meaning not using the WYSIWYG-Import-function... possibly.  
03:55 <jstoldt|Notebook> still, this is more than one and a half year ago, i'm way out og my league on both assumptions and knowledge on behaviour of the software!  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:51 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:53 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
06:16 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
06:18 <jstoldt|Notebook> has quit  
06:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <vmassol> great job everyone for the BFD! :) I'm preparing a blog post today about it with the results  
08:59 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <vmassol> I'm about to publish the blog post: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/BugFixingDayOctober2012  
09:23 <vmassol> anything you'd like me to change before I press the button? :)  
09:24 <vmassol> note that since it's a BFD the filter doesn't count improvements or new feature done during the day (since it's not the objective of the day)  
09:30 <vmassol> ok publishing  
09:51 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <+sburjan> Congratulations for the BFD to everyone ! the jira mailing list was the place to be yesterday :)  
10:05 <vmassol> has quit  
10:07 <jstoldt> has quit  
10:08 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

10:24 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

10:45 <mflorea> has quit  
10:47 <+sburjan> Good day vmassol . I saw your comment on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6683. Could http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6691 be the cause ? If yes, we should link the issues  
10:49 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:50 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
10:51 <vmassol> it could, best would be to try it… :)  
10:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <mflorea> has quit  
12:14 <polx> has quit  
12:17 <vmassol> hmm platform isn't building for me  
12:17 <vmassol> namely "XWiki Platform - Store - Filesystem - Attachments" is not builindg  
12:17 <vmassol> it's not compiling  
12:18 <vmassol> [ERROR] /Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-store/xwiki-platform-store-filesystem-attachments/src/main/java/org/xwiki/store/legacy/store/internal/AttachmentArchiveSaveRunnable.java:[70,31] cannot find symbol  
12:18 <vmassol> [ERROR] symbol  : class VoidAttachmentArchive  
12:18 <vmassol> [ERROR] location: class org.xwiki.store.legacy.store.internal.AttachmentArchiveSaveRunnable  
12:19 <vmassol> fixing  
12:20 <vmassol> hmm could it be that sergiu uses a text editor and not an IDEA to code ? :)  
12:46 <vmassol> ouch  
12:46 <vmassol> just rebuilt the whole XE  
12:46 <vmassol> and the home page is broken  
12:47 <vmassol> very broken  
12:47 <vmassol> Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.model.reference.EntityReferenceResolver] hint = [current]]  
12:47 <vmassol> called by at com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.skinx.AbstractDocumentSkinExtensionPlugin.getCanonicalDocumentName(AbstractDocumentSkinExtensionPlugin.java:421)  
12:48 <vmassol> seems to be related to sergiu's commit: df7caa353224b99fd5bcb748a845df3a433d761b  
12:50 <vmassol> trying to fix  
12:50 <vmassol> I know why  
12:50 <vmassol> but it means sergiu didn't even try it....  
13:01 <vmassol> tmortagne: testing your last commit on a clean isntall...  
13:02 <vmassol> (taking forever to download poms atm… over 5 mn so far)  
13:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: ping  
13:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: it works very well, no more merges! :) Only problem is that I get part of my wiki in chinese now …. :) see https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/1cba3f47-06be-4a5a-bd2a-2064a4c15758/595bd70d9be20bcb7d03ca8a90ca7434  
13:21 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:33 <vmassol> tm  
13:33 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: note that the last Main.Welcome doc imported is "Successfully imported document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language [zh\_TW]"  
13:34 <vmassol> It seems it's replacing the Main.Welcome in the default language  
13:34 <vmassol> indeed if I go to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome#History  
13:34 <vmassol> I see 3 versions  
13:34 <vmassol> 1.1, 2.1 and 3.1  
13:35 <vmassol> the comment is "Import"  
13:35 <vmassol> if I compare version 1.1 and 2.1 I can see it changes from english to some chinese  
13:36 <vmassol> and version 2.1 and 3.1 changed the laguage to another type of chinese  
13:37 <vmassol> ok I know why  
13:37 <vmassol> in the logs I have:  
13:37 <vmassol> Importing document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language []...  
13:37 <vmassol> Successfully imported document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language []  
13:37 <vmassol> Importing document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language [zh]...  
13:37 <vmassol> Successfully imported document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language [zh]  
13:37 <vmassol> Importing document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language [zh\_TW]...  
13:37 <vmassol> Successfully imported document [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome] in language [zh\_TW]  
13:37 <vmassol> so the default language was installed and then overwritten twice  
13:38 <vmassol> first time by zh and second time by zh\_TW  
13:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <polx> has quit  
13:54 <vmassol> evalica: btw don't know if you know about this but I have a vertical scrollbar on the home page dahsbaord on chrome  
13:55 <vmassol> there are not much but maybe 2-3 pixels that are causing it  
13:55 <vmassol> (maybe a bit more)  
13:56 <+evalica> it;s because of some imported pages with EM - I'll check  
13:56 <vmassol> I didn't realize about it since the scrollbar disappears after a second or so  
14:00 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <+evalica> vmassol: I tried to test but the last builded snapshot still has the problem http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8276 that generates the scrollbar. The issue is closed. I will wait for a new generated snapshot  
14:09 <vmassol> yes I'm on the latest from sources  
14:09 <vmassol> and I have it  
14:10 <polx> has quit  
14:13 <vmassol> jvelo: hi  
14:13 <jvelo> vmassol: hello  
14:13 <vmassol> jvelo: just noticed something strange  
14:13 <vmassol> in the search suggest if I type "test"  
14:14 <vmassol> I get Main.Welcome listed  
14:14 <vmassol> but if I go to the search page  
14:14 <vmassol> I don't have it  
14:14 <jvelo> what if you type "test\*" ?  
14:14 <jvelo> in the search page  
14:14 <vmassol> indeed  
14:14 <vmassol> so that's the difference between both  
14:15 <vmassol> thanks  
14:15 <jvelo> you can see which lucene query really gets executed looking at the XHR request w/ firebug  
14:16 <vmassol> not sure why I get a hit for test on Main.Welcome but that's another matter...  
14:16 <vmassol> ok thanks  
14:16 <jvelo> vmassol: yes with JV we took that decision to automatically suffix the search suggest term with \* so that it starts matching before you type an entire word  
14:16 <vmassol> yes that's fine I think  
14:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok I will look at what's wrong with translations  
14:28 <vmassol> o  
14:28 <vmassol> k  
15:06 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <polx> has quit  
15:07 <Slashman> has quit  
15:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f5f13212588efadb4708fff4077aa736405cc061  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> I don't understand why I have to do that  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> IIRC, it used to work  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> Did something change?  
15:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you were targeting old stuff  
15:14 <vmassol> which are now in legacy  
15:14 <vmassol> that's been changed when we introduced support for generic in the CM  
15:14 <vmassol> \*generics  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> But even after that I thought that it still worked  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> Was I wrong?  
15:15 <vmassol> it works if you have legacy  
15:15 <vmassol> but all code in platform should build and run without legacy  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> OK, I see  
15:20 <vmassol> I noticed that the dokuwiki.org wiki was open for edits  
15:20 <vmassol> you can go there and edit any content (except home page) without needing to register/login  
15:20 <vmassol> I've just asked them on IRC the amount of effort required  
15:20 <vmassol> first answer: "vmassol.  there can be quite a bit of spam, although I haven't done much monitoring of it for a long time.  try opening up for a while and see how you go.  Do make sure you have an easy way of unwinding edits - preferably unwinding all recent edits by a single user/ip."  
15:21 <vmassol> "preferably unwinding all recent edits by a single user/ip" is a good idea  
15:21 <+tmortagne> yep  
15:21 <vmassol> it could be an interesting experiment to try  
15:21 <@sdumitriu> There's an issue that I created about 6 years ago about this  
15:21 <+tmortagne> by IP could be a bit hard since we don't have that information  
15:21 <vmassol> @tmortagne: that solves the "register" button for xwiki.org ;)  
15:22 <+tmortagne> sure  
15:22 <vmassol> we would need to have the ip  
15:22 <vmassol> and use the ip as the user  
15:22 <+tmortagne> but then I'm sure sure what have the right to store the IP for too long  
15:22 <+tmortagne> s/what/we/  
15:23 <vmassol> well at least they store it forever on dokuwiki  
15:23 <vmassol> you check the history for a page  
15:23 <+sburjan> and IP's can be dynamic also  
15:23 <vmassol> sure  
15:23 <vmassol> the part that I like is that they're following the true spirit of the wiki by doing this  
15:23 <+tmortagne> sure but it does not change that often and in our case it will probably be for pretty short timeframe  
15:23 <vmassol> (ie open edits)  
15:24 <+tmortagne> yep
